meanings.definition: Firm and stable in shape; not liquid or fluid.
meanings.sent1: The table was solid and did not wobble.
meanings.sent2: She built a solid sandcastle at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The solid ground refused to turn into quicksand under his feet.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship was as solid as a rock, unwavering and strong.
meanings.sent5: The solid oak door withstood the strong winds without budging.

meanings.definition: Strong and reliable; not easily broken or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The solid rope held the weight of the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: He was a solid choice for the team captain.
meanings.sent3: The solid umbrella shielded her from both rain and sun.
meanings.sent4: Their bond was as solid as a steel chain, unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The solid foundation of the building ensured its stability during the storm.

meanings.definition: A three-dimensional geometric figure with length, width, and height.
meanings.sent1: The child played with a solid cube in the shape sorter toy.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the building using various solid shapes.
meanings.sent3: The solid in the geometry class rolled off the desk and caused a commotion.
meanings.sent4: His love for math was as solid as a perfectly shaped sphere.
meanings.sent5: The sculpture artist carved a beautiful solid out of marble.
